title: Least favorite aspects of your favorite champions
body: We all have our mains but not every champion is perfect. What some things that you hate about your favorite champion, game play wise, lore wise or otherwise?

replies.body:
{{champion:98}} Saving your allies means you lose your turret

{{champion:245}} He's kinda bad at being an assassin tbh. He's more of a skirmisher.

{{champion:8}}  Using your W or E without some items takes half (hyperbole) of your health.
http://i.imgur.com/zPdQvte.png?noredirect
My beef with veigar is that every time I make a short joke it goes over his head.
https://i.pinimg.com/736x/9d/4d/75/9d4d75d0b57b00e83a32a24cafe9d804--league-of-legends-meme-league-memes.jpg

{{champion:223}} I swear his W eats something I didn't click on half the time. I click on a fully stacked enemy and he turns around to eat an ally. I click to eat ally, he eats a minion. Not sure if it's wonky or I am just really uneven with my clicking.

I saw something on this!  Apparently, it's because a champion gets to three stack *visually* half a second before they get to three stacks *mechanically*, so often people will W *right* when they see the three stacks, or even when they anticipate the three stacks, and a person's reaction time in this situation is somehow faster than the game's

> [{quoted}](name=Tattersall,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oOsEXA4u,comment-id=001a0000,timestamp=2017-09-30T23:13:51.905+0000)
>
> I saw something on this!  Apparently, it's because a champion gets to three stack *visually* half a second before they get to three stacks *mechanically*, so often people will W *right* when they see the three stacks, or even when they anticipate the three stacks, and a person's reaction time in this situation is somehow faster than the game's

OMG, so I'm not crazy lol! They should seriously find a way to match these up cause it can really frustrate my allies when I accidentally eat them mid-fight.
{{champion:55}}  katarina's repetitive quotes although i love her personality she just has so few quotes it makes me sad
{{champion:86}} If I would ask you about all his quotes you could only say two, right?
If you run, you won't see me stab you !

{{champion:25}} 
"Not all angels are good."
'You too will be judged."
"Not all angels are good."
'You too will be judged."
"Not all angels are good."
'You too will be judged."

"Not all angels are good."

"Not all angels are good."

"Not all angels are good."

{{champion:44}}   Stupid mana problems until you get a couple items.
And then you get that couple times and suddendly you feel like you have _too much_ mana.
I always feel like i need more mana on him
One can never have enough mana
{{champion:113}} : Garbage rework

What particularly do you not like?

I really don't play her anymore because of the rework.

I just don't like any of it. 

Riot completely changed the way Sej played, from a DPS based AoE damage dealer/soft CC champ to a single target lockdown champ who primarily relies on burst damage but generally had a massive dropoff in damage. E working with melee champs just allows Sejuani to circumvent anything that would be a weakness of the kit like proper kitting or peel just by playing with the right team comp. W and E feel clunky to use compared to the old spells since they lock you out of doing anything else and her R just feels like a glorified Cocoon.

She completely lost all of her gameplay identity because Riot chased too far down their rabbit hole of 'melee synergy' without ever stopping to look at the effects it was having on the kit. She's no longer the bruiser/tank hybrid she was, rather she's just a generic tank, just like every other generic tank in the game.

{{champion:43}} Least favorite rework.

She's still my highest mastery but her rework literally failed at its main goal: making her less dependent on Mantra.
So you're not a FAN of it?

{{champion:50}}: Has this awesome fantasy of a powerful general but is simply just a warlock in game, hopefully the rework can clean that up a bit
{{champion:223}}: No one ever appreciates being eaten to save them
{{champion:201}}: Whenever you're really in a pinch no one ever just lets you jump to them goddammit
{{champion:99}} Let me move while using shield.... plz ;--;

{{champion:83}} : Maiden, follow me.

MotM: *continues to push lane instead*

{{champion:83}} : M-maiden, I uh... could use you over here to take drag.

MotM: *killed by turret*

{{champion:83}} : ......... Damn it.......

> [{quoted}](name=Toxic Control,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oOsEXA4u,comment-id=005c,timestamp=2017-10-01T06:59:46.884+0000)
>
> {{champion:83}} : Maiden, follow me.
> 
> MotM: *continues to push lane instead*
> 
> {{champion:83}} : M-maiden, I uh... could use you over here to take drag.
> 
> MotM: *killed by turret*
> 
> {{champion:83}} : ......... Damn it.......

So dang true.

Riot, is too much to ask to give Yorick a LITTLE MORE control over the Maiden? I mean, Annie and Ivern can each reactivate their ults to be able to "call" Tibbers and Daisy, respectively, back to them. What's the deal with Yorick not being able to do the same?

She's supposed to be alot of our dear Shepherd's combat-power, so what's wrong with him being able to ACTUALLY have her come and help him if he gets caught out or something like that?
{{champion:35}}  Lets nerf ult damage and givin it 3 box in compensation ! What a nice rework !
Talon- short form of engage, that basically tells the enemy "I CANT DODGE RIGHT NOW PLEASE KILL ME". All damage gated behind passive. Dont care so much about the second

{{champion:103}} her w. Whenever it's strong she gets nerfed because of its reliability, which should be enough for it to get reworked, but Riot stated they don't want to make all of her basic skills skillshots which would actually make sense to do since they obviously want her to rely on skillshots which would be fine. But otherwise it's a bland skill that you just press and forget, and even the neat little perk it had of being counted as single target doesn't matter anymore after the rework and gutting of Rylai's plus spellvamp removal.

{{champion:21}} her e being almost completely untouched every time they've given her a mini rework despite being perhaps the most historically complained about part of her kit. Her love taps passive forcing her to have the lowest base ad in the game, causing her sustained single target dmg to be incredibly weak by adc standards despite her nice attack speed steroid. Price of the team wiping ultimate potential I guess, but I wouldn't mind if they took power out of her ult and shifted it into the rest of her kit so she'd be less of a walking R.

Wow, I didn't expect to type that much, I got gripes for real
She got relaunched and is nothing compart to who or how she was and is now someone I hate. {{champion:43}}

{{champion:16}} taking baron nashor

you only have one damaging skill that affects nashor and it doesn't even give you the rejuvenation buff the way rakan get's  to heal off epic monsters, so the baron's passive "take magic damage just for being in combat with him" shreds your healthbar and really makes using your w painful.
Taliyah: Vector cast, lockout removal, and all the other stupid changes that happened to compensate for those.
Like gutting her E
More like gutting her everything. She was supposed to be a kite/skrimish mage but reddit threw a fit and wanted her to be a combo mage, which got her gutted.
I thought she was originally designed to be a roaming control mage and turned her into a pseudo burst mage with the lockout removal.

Both are correct, she is like a roaming/skimirsh mage with strong kiting (which makes sense since mages dont really want to go into melee range), reduced to a one trick pony burst/combo mage at the cost of everything else being gutted.

I played her yesterday and it was easily one of the worst midlane experiences I had in months.
I still like playing her, but she lost a lot of her identity when they removed lockout.

{{champion:222}} https://youtu.be/BdtSbHv4kd4

Every. Single. Time.

>Stacking passive in RGM's is a chore.



I personally think his passive should be tweaked in RGMS to stack faster. It's ridiculous playing something like Nexus Siege and you still don't have your transformation even when the enemy is knocking on your inhib.

Morgana - Long CDs and windows of doing nothing, very short range auto attack range.

Doesn't really match her character as a divine angel sorceress of unlimited power.

{{champion:61}} Outdated model, voice lines that don't correspond with her lore, and her passive. It just feels like she could get a way better one that works with her ball; idk.

{{sticker:sg-janna}}
I agree with the first two, but Ori's passive is *great*.

{{champion:202}} Oh, you are below half-health? FOUR!

_An enemy has been slain_
How can you not like that?
{{champion:98}}  Unfinished rework (no running animation, B animation, new voicelines) lack of legendary/ultimate skin.

{{champion:103}} - everyone hates her, don't like her W.  
{{champion:102}} - I dunno.  I guess that her dragon form doesn't have 4 legs.
{{champion:37}} - a little too squishy, I'm not fond of the E either.
{{champion:16}} - the self damage on her W

You could die so easily in early levels as Sona when mage supports were popular; it was ridiculous.
It was a ~~dark~~ _**grey**_ time.
{{champion:240}} That damn delay before you get Skaarl's health
